Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.middleware

Class Connection

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.view.middleware.Messenger
      • it.polimi.ingsw.view.middleware.Connection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class Connection
extends Messenger
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Handles communication between a client and the server on the server's side.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Connection

        public Connection​(java.net.Socket socket,
                  Server server)
        Constructs an instance of a Connection object, that handles communication between a client and the server, on the servers's side.
        Parameters:
        socket - the connection socket.
        server - a reference to the server.

    • Method Detail

      • setView

        public void setView​(View view)
        Called by the server when setting the relative virtual view. Handles the construction of the method map, that has to happen here as the virtual view contains the observables that will send the notifies.
        Parameters:
        view - the virtual view associated to this connection.

      • getObservable

        protected java.lang.Object getObservable​(java.lang.String methodName)
        Always returns the controller, regardless of the methodName. This happens because the communication from on object that implements the View interface to an object that implements the ControllerInterface happens directly, and not through an observable class.
        Specified by:
        getObservable in class Messenger
        Parameters:
        methodName - the useless parameter...
        Returns:
        the controller.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage​(java.lang.String methodName,
                        java.lang.Object... arg)
        Delegate the actual sending process to the superclass Messenger. Avoids the need for the caller to know the correct output stream.
        Specified by:
        sendMessage in class Messenger
        Parameters:
        methodName - the name of the method triggered by the message.
        arg - the object representing the eventual arguments to be passed.

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs in a separate thread on the server's side, handling incoming communications from the client to the server. Creates and runs the thread checking periodically the client's aliveness and the one that actually executes the calls on the the virtual view, according to the message queue.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • close

        private void close()
        Closes the socket connection.
